New Records: South Africa maintained their reputation for winning games they ought to lose in the T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: Jaker Ali was caught by Aiden Markram on the straight boundary trying to hit the six that would win it for Bangladesh
Mahmudullah was caught by Aiden Markram, and the umpires had already robbed Bangladesh of four leg byes that had ricocheted away off Mahmudullah's pads
Taskin Ahmed needed to hit the last ball for six to win, but he couldn't
Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller put on a match-winning 75, largely against Bangladesh's spinners
Pre-Game Insights: The crowd was filled with Bangladeshis, who had come to watch their team beat South Africa, and had a lot to cheer for, except the one thing they wanted
Bangladesh played one of the better games any team have turned in at the Nassau County ground
Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh deserved better, especially Towhid Hridoy, who had held everything together with his fine 37
It was a shame it ended that way
Mahmudullah couldn't believe it, and stood his ground a while, waiting for a review that never came
Miscellaneous Highlights: The number of Bangladeshi-Americans living in New York has tripled in the past decade, and now runs to approximately 100,000
The crowd was just as loud as India's, but a little smaller
In this tournament South Africa, who have a reputation for losing games they ought to win, seem to be winning all the ones they ought to lose
Others: Quinton de Kock carted Tanzim Hasan Sakib for a six over square leg and then a four through long-on
Hasan bowled De Kock, then had Tristan Stubbs caught at cover for a duck
Ahmed bowled Markram with a delivery that moved just enough off the pitch
